- Topic: Approval of the Minutes for November 4, 2021 and November 18, 2021
- Summary: The minutes for the specified dates were approved during the meeting.
- Ordinance Number: N/A
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)

- Topic: Communication from Erin Spears - Chief of Staff & Counsel, Council Utilities Regulatory Office
- Summary: Communication related to electric and gas utility matters, including Entergy New Orleans, LLC financing plan, New Orleans Technical Reference Manual, and Alliance for Affordable Energy petition for intervention.
- Ordinance Number: N/A
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: N/A
- Decision/Key Actions: Communication electronically submitted and received.

- Topic: Communication from Eric Smith, Analyst, Chief Administrative Office, City of New Orleans
- Summary: Submission of the Board of City Trusts 2020 Attendance Record in accordance with the City’s Municipal Code.
- Ordinance Number: N/A
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: N/A

- Topic: Communication from Tracy David Madison, Secretary, Board of Liquidation, City Debt
- Summary: Submission of the Board of Liquidation, City Debt's resolution recommending a millage levy of 19.5 mills to service the City's bonded debt in 2022, and the bids received for the purchase of City of New Orleans Limited Tax Bonds.
- Ordinance Number: N/A
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: N/A
- Decision/Key Actions: Communication electronically submitted and received.
- Tags/Keywords: Board of Liquidation, City Debt, millage levy, bonded debt, limited tax bonds
- UID: 2dbb25c6-762f-4da7-9bc5-d3f644ff68bd

- Topic: Downtown Development District Limited Tax Bonds, Series 2021
- Summary: Tracy D. Madison, Secretary of the Board of Liquidation, City Debt, informed the Council about the bids received for the purchase of $6,500,000.00 Downtown Development District Limited Tax Bonds, Series 2021. The bid with the lowest True Interest Cost of 1.73% was awarded to Truist Bank.
- Ordinance Number: N/A
- Votes Summary:
  Vote 1: N/A
- Decision/Key Actions: The Limited Tax Bonds, Series 2021 were awarded to Truist Bank.
- Tags/Keywords: Limited Tax Bonds, Downtown Development District, Truist Bank, True Interest Cost, Bid
- UID: 8f505a4b-f7fd-4dca-9d0d-5bd43509f486

- Topic: Loan Agreement for Sewerage Service Revenue Bonds, Series 2021
- Summary: Tracy D. Madison, Secretary of the Board of Liquidation, City Debt, informed the Council about the approval of the Loan Agreement between the Sewerage and Water Board of New Orleans and the Environmental Protection Agency to issue not exceed $275,000,000 Sewerage Service Revenue Bonds, Series 2021 (WIFIA Projects) at an interest rate of 1.85%.
- Ordinance Number: N/A
- Votes Summary:
  Vote 1: N/A
- Decision/Key Actions: The Loan Agreement was approved.
- Tags/Keywords: Loan Agreement, Sewerage Service Revenue Bonds, Series 2021, Sewerage and Water Board, Environmental Protection Agency
- UID: 8f505a4b-f7fd-4dca-9d0d-5bd43509f486

- Topic: Appeal of Vieux Carré Commission's Decision
- Summary: Edward T. Suffern, Jr., on behalf of 326-30 Chartres St. L.L.C., requested an appeal to the Vieux Carré Commission’s decision of “denial” on October 20, 2021, to retain and rebuild a rooftop deck installed by a prior property owner without benefit of VCC review and approval for the property located at 326 Chartres Street.
- Ordinance Number: N/A
- Votes Summary:
  Vote 1: N/A
- Decision/Key Actions: Appeal requested, Hearing Date Set For 12/16/21
- Tags/Keywords: Vieux Carré Commission, Appeal, 326 Chartres St., Rooftop Deck
- UID: 8f505a4b-f7fd-4dca-9d0d-5bd43509f486

- Topic: CAL. NO. 33,460 - BY: COUNCILMEMBER BANKS (BY REQUEST)
- Summary: An ordinance to amend and reordain Section 50-86 of Chapter 50 of the Code of the City of New Orleans to provide certain employees with benefits.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,460
- Votes Summary: N/A
- Decision/Key Actions: N/A
- Tags/Keywords: Ordinance, employee benefits, amendment

- Topic: Departmental Powers and Affidavit Verification
- Summary: This ordinance grants certain employees of different departments the power to take oaths and verify affidavits made by other employees within their respective departments.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,460
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: N/A - (Postponed to 12/16/21 meeting)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was postponed to the meeting of 12/16/21 for further consideration.
- UID: 556f3e6b-Sde1-1lec-85e3-0050569183fa

- Topic: Police Deputization and Limited Powers
- Summary: This ordinance amends the authority of the Superintendent of Police to deputize non-police force members to exercise limited police powers, specifying their entitlement to compensation and benefits, as well as the promulgation of regulations.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,461
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: N/A - (Postponed to 12/16/21 meeting)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was postponed to the meeting of 12/16/21 for further consideration.
- UID: 534d12dd-ed92-469a-9401-547fc55c1dc7

- Topic: Amendments to Ordinance No. 33,461
- Summary: These amendments introduce additional provisions regarding the background checking of deputized individuals, their ability to issue citations, restrictions on the use of force and firearms, and the use of crime information networks.
- Ordinance Number: Amendment to CAL. NO. 33,461
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: N/A - (Postponed to 12/16/21 meeting)
- Decision/Key Actions: The amendments were postponed to the meeting of 12/16/21 for further consideration.
- UID: 534d12dd-ed92-469a-9401-547fc55c1dc7

- Topic: Amendment to Section 138-37 of Article II of Chapter 138 of the Code of the City of New Orleans
- Summary: The ordinance seeks to authorize the Superintendent of Police to grant enforcement and citation powers to employees of the Department of Sanitation for specific provisions of the city code. 
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,462
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (N/A, N/A, N/A, N/A)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed without any noted amendments or discussions.
- Tags/Keywords: New Orleans, Department of Sanitation, enforcement, citation powers
- UID: 6630e4fd-8f72-40ba-8e7f-d522b10abeb6

- Topic: Amendment of Enforcement and Citation Powers for City Departments
- Summary: This ordinance aims to grant enforcement and citation powers to employees of various city departments for the purpose of enforcing specific provisions of the City Code. The ordinance was recommended for approval by the Community Development Committee and was continued to the meeting of 12/16/21.
- Ordinance Number: 33,463
- Votes Summary:
   Vote 1: N/A - (N/A)
- Decision/Key Actions: Recommended for approval by the Community Development Committee and continued to the next meeting.
- Tags/Keywords: City Code, enforcement powers, citation powers, Community Development Committee
- UID: 556f3e6b-Sde1-1 lec-85e3-0050569183fa

- Topic: Extension of Enforcement Powers for Mosquito, Termite, and Rodent Control Board
- Summary: This ordinance seeks to authorize the Superintendent of Police to grant enforcement and citation powers to employees of the New Orleans Mosquito, Termite, and Rodent Control Board for the purpose of enforcing specific provisions of the City Code. The Community Development Committee recommended approval, and the ordinance was continued to the meeting of 12/16/21.
- Ordinance Number: 33,464
- Votes Summary:
   Vote 1: N/A - (N/A)
- Decision/Key Actions: Recommended for approval by the Community Development Committee and continued to the next meeting.
- Tags/Keywords: Mosquito Control Board, enforcement powers, citation powers, Community Development Committee
- UID: 556f3e6b-Sde1-1 lec-85e3-0050569183fa

- Topic: Expansion of Enforcement Powers for Ground Transportation Bureau
- Summary: This ordinance aims to allow employees of the Ground Transportation Bureau within the Department of Public Works to enforce certain provisions of the City Code. It also grants enforcement and citation powers to these employees for the purpose of enforcing specific provisions of the City Code. The Community Development Committee recommended approval, and the ordinance was continued to the meeting of 12/16/21.
- Ordinance Number: 33,465
- Votes Summary:
   Vote 1: N/A - (N/A)
- Decision/Key Actions: Recommended for approval by the Community Development Committee and continued to the next meeting.
- Tags/Keywords: Ground Transportation Bureau, enforcement powers, citation powers, Community Development Committee
- UID: 556f3e6b-Sde1-1 lec-85e3-0050569183fa

- Topic: Building Standards for Motor Fuel Dispensing Facilities
- Summary: This ordinance introduces new building standards for motor fuel dispensing facilities and mandates alternate generated power capacity at these facilities. The ordinance was continued to the meeting of 12/16/21.
- Ordinance Number: 33,485
- Votes Summary:
   Vote 1: N/A - (N/A)
- Decision/Key Actions: Continued to the next meeting.
- Tags/Keywords: Motor fuel dispensing facilities, building standards, power capacity
- UID: 556f3e6b-Sde1-1 lec-85e3-0050569183fa

- Topic: Sanitation Fee Reduction
- Summary: This ordinance mandates a fifty-percent reduction in the sanitation fee until the Mayor restores twice weekly collection citywide. The ordinance was continued to the meeting of 12/16/21.
- Ordinance Number: 33,509
- Votes Summary:
   Vote 1: N/A - (N/A)
- Decision/Key Actions: Continued to the next meeting.
- Tags/Keywords: Sanitation fee, fee reduction, collection frequency
- UID: 556f3e6b-Sde1-1 lec-85e3-0050569183fa

- Topic: Building Standards for Motor Fuel Dispensing Facilities
- Summary: The ordinance aims to establish building standards for motor fuel dispensing facilities and mandate alternate generated power capacity. The Community Development Committee recommended approval, and the ordinance was continued to the meeting of 12/16/21.
- Ordinance Number: 33465
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: N/A
- Decision/Key Actions: Referred to the Community Development Committee, recommended for approval, continued to the meeting of 12/16/21
- Tags/Keywords: Building standards, Motor fuel dispensing facilities, Alternate power capacity
- UID: ec3f691e-fe66-4370-8853-20bcea526478

- Topic: Sanitation Fee Reduction
- Summary: This ordinance proposes a fifty-percent reduction in the sanitation fee until the Mayor restores twice-weekly collection citywide. The outcome of the vote was not provided, and the ordinance was continued to the meeting of 12/16/21.
- Ordinance Number: 33485
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: N/A
- Decision/Key Actions: N/A
- Tags/Keywords: Sanitation fee, Reduction, Collection frequency

- Topic: Zoning Changes for Casino Renovations and Hotel Construction
- Summary: The ordinance aims to amend zoning ordinances to remove original provisos and add new ones related to casino renovations and the construction of a new hotel. It pertains to the entirety of Square RS in the First Municipal District. The ordinance was continued to the meeting of 12/16/21.
- Ordinance Number: 33509
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: N/A - (N/A)
- Decision/Key Actions: Continued to the meeting of 12/16/21
- Tags/Keywords: Zoning, Casino, Hotel, Ordinance, Municipal District
- UID: 685c5982-72fe-473b-b0dc-0243dcbbe449

- Topic: Minimum Operational Requirements for Police Department Crime Laboratory
- Summary: This ordinance aims to establish minimum operational requirements for the New Orleans Police Department Crime Laboratory, including units accredited to test and analyze DNA, as well as regular reporting requirements on sexual assault collection kits. The ordinance was continued to the meeting of 12/16/21.
- Ordinance Number: 33527
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: N/A - (N/A)
- Decision/Key Actions: Continued to the meeting of 12/16/21
- Tags/Keywords: Police Department, Crime Laboratory, DNA Analysis, Sexual Assault Kits, Ordinance
- UID: 685c5982-72fe-473b-b0dc-0243dcbbe449

- Topic: Evaluation of Classified Pay Plan for Police Technical Staff
- Summary: This ordinance requires the Department of City Civil Service to evaluate and provide recommendations to increase the minimum annual salary of certain job series within the police technical staff to market rate. The ordinance was amended and passed.
- Ordinance Number: 33528
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Amendment - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
    Vote 2: As Amended - (5 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 2 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: Amended and passed
- Tags/Keywords: Classified Pay Plan, Police Technical Staff, Civil Service, Salary, Ordinance
- UID: 685c5982-72fe-473b-b0dc-0243dcbbe449

- Topic: Property Lease Authorization for New Orleans Redevelopment Authority
- Summary: This ordinance authorizes the Mayor of the City of New Orleans to execute a lease with the New Orleans Redevelopment Authority for a specific property. The details of the outcome are not provided in the summary.
- Ordinance Number: 33539
- Votes Summary: N/A
- Decision/Key Actions: Details of the outcome not provided
- Tags/Keywords: Property Lease, New Orleans Redevelopment Authority, Ordinance
- UID: 685c5982-72fe-473b-b0dc-0243dcbbe449

- Topic: Temporary Waiver of Fees for Special Olympics Event at Lemann Playground
- Summary: The ordinance aimed to temporarily waive certain fees and permit requirements for the Special Olympics Louisiana Bayou Classic Event at Lemann Playground. The duration and boundaries of the waiver were specified. The ordinance was adopted with 5 YEAS and 0 NAYS.
- Ordinance Number: 33545
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Adopt - (5 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 2 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: Adoption of the ordinance to waive fees for the specified event.
- Tags/Keywords: Fees waiver, Special Olympics, Lemann Playground
- UID: 8a40f649-0d7e-446c-81f4-e117ae99bebc

- Topic: Cooperative Endeavor Agreement for Bioscience and Health Products
- Summary: The ordinance authorized the Mayor to enter into a Cooperative Endeavor Agreement with the BioDistrict New Orleans for the purpose of using incremental increases in undedicated taxes to induce economic development in the bioscience and health products sector. The ordinance was withdrawn.
- Ordinance Number: 33553
- Votes Summary: N/A
- Decision/Key Actions: Withdrawal of the ordinance for the Cooperative Endeavor Agreement.
- Tags/Keywords: Cooperative Endeavor Agreement, BioDistrict New Orleans, bioscience, health products
- UID: 8a40f649-0d7e-446c-81f4-e117ae99bebc

- Topic: Renaming of Louisa Street portion to Johnny Jackson Jr. Avenue
- Summary: The ordinance proposed changing the name of a portion of Louisa Street to Johnny Jackson Jr. Avenue. The ordinance was continued to the next meeting.
- Ordinance Number: 33555
- Votes Summary: N/A
- Decision/Key Actions: Continuation of the ordinance for renaming the street.
- Tags/Keywords: Street renaming, Louisa Street, Johnny Jackson Jr. Avenue
- UID: 8a40f649-0d7e-446c-81f4-e117ae99bebc

- Topic: Waiver of Fees for Family Fun Day Event at Joe W. Brown Memorial Park
- Summary: The ordinance ratified and confirmed the waiver of certain fees and permit requirements for the Mystic Krewe of Femme Fatale Family Fun Day event at Joe W. Brown Memorial Park. The duration and boundaries of the waiver were specified. The ordinance details and voting outcomes are available at the provided link.
- Ordinance Number: 33556
- Votes Summary: N/A
- Decision/Key Actions: Ratification and confirmation of the waiver for the specified event.
- Tags/Keywords: Fees waiver, Mystic Krewe of Femme Fatale, Joe W. Brown Memorial Park
- UID: 8a40f649-0d7e-446c-81f4-e117ae99bebc

- Topic: Temporary Waiver of Fees for Event at Joe W. Brown Memorial Park
- Summary: The ordinance sought to temporarily waive certain fees, permit fees, and requirements for an event at Joe W. Brown Memorial Park. It specified the duration and boundaries of the waiver for the Phi Beta Sigma - Theta Beta Sigma Chapter Membership Celebration event on December 4, 2021.
- Ordinance Number: 33556 - 28879 M.C.S.
- Votes Summary:
    - Vote 1: Adopted - (5 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 2 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was adopted with 5 council members voting in favor, 0 against, and 2 absent.
- Tags/Keywords: Fee Waiver, Joe W. Brown Memorial Park, Event, Phi Beta Sigma, Temporary Waiver
- UID: 553f0a3d-093a-47de-8b2a-61f24ea1e5b9

- Topic: Amendment to City Council Rule 10 - Note B
- Summary: The motion aimed to amend City Council Rule 10 - Note B, concerning the City Council's Consent Agenda and related procedures, by replacing it in its entirety as provided in "Exhibit A."
- Ordinance Number: M-21-121
- Votes Summary:

- Votes Summary:

- Votes Summary:

- Summary: SMS Development LLC requested a demolition permit for the property at 2043 Oretha C. Haley Blvd, which was continued to the meeting of 12/16/21.

- Topic: Request for Administrative Extension of Time for Recording Approved Conditional Use Plans
- Summary: David R. Sherman, on behalf of St. Charles Holdings, L.L.C., requested an extension of time to record approved conditional use plans for Zoning Docket 036/19. The request was continued to the meeting of 12/16/21.
- Ordinance Number: ZD No. 36-19
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: N/A

- Topic: Text Amendment to Comprehensive Zoning Ordinance (ZD NO. 84/21)
- Summary: The City Council considered a text amendment to the Comprehensive Zoning Ordinance to incorporate zoning standards in accordance with adopted language to certain Future Land Use Map designations and provide incentives for developments with affordable housing components. The recommendation of the City Planning Commission was for modified approval. The motion to grant the text amendment request was continued to the meeting of 12/16/21.
- Ordinance Number: ZD NO. 84-21
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: N/A
- Decision/Key Actions: Continued to the meeting of 12/16/21
- Tags/Keywords: Text Amendment, Zoning, Affordable Housing
- UID: 1599ccf6-ad9d-429b-bb17-ee92985e8489

- Topic: Planned Development in HU-RD2 Historic Urban Two-Family Residential District (ZD NO. 85/21)
- Summary: 217 South Rendon LLC requested a Planned Development in an HU-RD2 Historic Urban Two-Family Residential District and an HUC Historic Urban Corridor Use Restriction Overlay District to allow the adaptive re-use of an existing institutional structure as a multiple-family residence. The recommendation of the City Planning Commission was no recommendation. The ordinance was continued to the meeting of 12/16/21.
- Ordinance Number: ZD NO. 85-21
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: N/A
- Decision/Key Actions: Continued to the meeting of 12/16/21
- Tags/Keywords: Planned Development, Historic Urban District, Adaptive Re-use
- UID: 1599ccf6-ad9d-429b-bb17-ee92985e8489

- Topic: Zoning Docket No. 76/21 - Samuel Bavido

- Topic: Zoning Text Amendment for Affordable Housing
- Summary: The ordinance requests a text amendment to the Comprehensive Zoning Ordinance to incorporate zoning standards in line with certain Future Land Use Map designations and provide incentives and permissions for developments with affordable housing components. The proposal would affect properties citywide.

- Votes Summary:
    - Vote 1: Adopted - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
